trans-unit.source: Stride is cross-platform game engine. This means you can create your game once, then compile and deploy it on all the platforms Stride supports. The engine converts C# and shaders to the different native languages, and abstracts the concepts that differ between platforms, so you don't have to adapt your code for each platform.
trans-unit.target: Stride is cross-platform game engine. This means you can create your game once, then compile and deploy it on all the platforms Stride supports. The engine converts C# and shaders to the different native languages, and abstracts the concepts that differ between platforms, so you don't have to adapt your code for each platform.

trans-unit.source: !TIP To check which platform your project uses, add a break point to your code (eg in a script), run the project, and check the Platform.Type variable.
trans-unit.target: !TIP To check which platform your project uses, add a break point to your code (eg in a script), run the project, and check the Platform.Type variable.

trans-unit.source: !Note Stride only supports MSAA (multisample anti-aliasing) for Direct3D 11 and later. Depending on your device's OpenGL shader compiler, Stride might not run with OpenGL ES2.
trans-unit.target: !Note Stride only supports MSAA (multisample anti-aliasing) for Direct3D 11 and later. Depending on your device's OpenGL shader compiler, Stride might not run with OpenGL ES2.

trans-unit.source: !Warning Direct3D 9 doesn't support HDR textures. Using HDR textures with DirextX 9 will crash your game.
trans-unit.target: !Warning Direct3D 9 doesn't support HDR textures. Using HDR textures with DirextX 9 will crash your game.

trans-unit.source: You set the graphics platform in the Game settings asset under Rendering settings > Target graphics platform.
trans-unit.target: You set the graphics platform in the Game settings asset under Rendering settings > Target graphics platform.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see Set the graphics platform.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see Set the graphics platform.

trans-unit.source: Stride defines preprocessor variables if you want to write code that compiles only under a specific platform. For more information, see Preprocessor variables.
trans-unit.target: Stride defines preprocessor variables if you want to write code that compiles only under a specific platform. For more information, see Preprocessor variables.
